vague_description: Determining the optimal distribution of cough syrup between different bottle sizes while adhering to specific manufacturing constraints.
detailed_description: A cough syrup company sells cough syrup in kids and adult size bottles. A kids size bottle can hold \param{VolKid} ml of cough syrup while an adult size bottle can hold \param{VolAdult} ml of cough syrup. Since there is no difference in concentration of medical ingredients between the two bottles, at least \param{RatioAdultToKids} times as many adult size bottle must be made as kids size bottles. However, at least \param{MinKidBottles} kids size bottles must be made. If the company has \param{TotalSyrup} ml of cough syrup available, how many bottles of each should be made to maximize the total number of bottles?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of bottles produced
target_constraints: Number of kids size bottles is an integer
Number of adult size bottles is an integer
Number of kids size bottles is non-negative
Number of adult size bottles is non-negative
Total volume of cough syrup used cannot exceed TotalSyrup ml
At least RatioAdultToKids times as many adult size bottles must be made as kids size bottles
At least MinKidBottles kids size bottles must be made
target_parameters: Volume of cough syrup that a kids size bottle can hold
Volume of cough syrup that an adult size bottle can hold
Ratio of the number of adult size bottles to kids size bottles
Minimum required number of kids size bottles
Total volume of cough syrup available
